org.qi4j.valueserialization.jackson

Class JacksonValueDeserializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qi4j.spi.value.ValueDeserializerAdapter<com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode>
      • org.qi4j.valueserialization.jackson.JacksonValueDeserializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueDeserializer

    public class JacksonValueDeserializer
extends ValueDeserializerAdapter<com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode>
    ValueDeserializer reading Values from JSON documents using Jackson.

      • readMapInMap

        protected <K,V> Map<K,V> readMapInMap(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser input,
                          Function<com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser,K> keyDeserializer,
                          Function<com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser,V> valueDeserializer,
                          Map<K,V> map)
                         throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ValueDeserializerAdapter
        A Map<K,V> is serialized in an array of entries objects.

        Here is an example in JSON:

         [
     { "key": "foo",       "value": "bar"   },
     { "key": "cathedral", "value": "bazar" }
 ]

        And an empty Map:

        []

        This allow to use any type as keys and values while keeping the Map order at the cost of having non-predictible order of key/value inside an entry object.

        Specified by:
        readMapInMap in class ValueDeserializerAdapter<com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode>
        Type Parameters:
        K - Parameterized map key type
        V - Parameterized map value type
        Parameters:
        input - Input
        keyDeserializer - Map key deserialization function
        valueDeserializer - Map value deserialization function
        map - Map
        Returns:
        The filled map or null if no array
        Throws:
        Exception - that will be wrapped in a ValueSerializationException
